direction.raw_text: Shhhh! Shh! Nice baby... He starts to lower it back into the crib. The crib is unpainted with the name of each baby burned Bonanza-style into the headboard: Harry, Barry, Larry, Garry, and Nathan Jr. Instead of quieting as he is lowered into the crib, the squalling baby only sets off one of his brothers. Hi hurriedly lifts him back out. He looks desperately around the room. The room is wallpapered with nursery rhyme characters. There are toys strewn around. There is one adult-sized easy chair in the corner. Hi carries the baby over to the chair, stepping on and reacting to the squeal of a squeeze-me toy on the way. He sits the baby deep in - the chair and then returns to the crib to deal with the second crying baby. He lifts the baby out of the crib and gently bounces it. This baby stops crying. Another one in the crib starts bawling. Hi sets the second baby down on the floor and gives it a rattle to keep it pacified. He reaches for the third baby in the crib. Sweat stands out on Hi 's brow. He is desperately chucking the third baby under the chin when we hear a muffled PTHUMP! He whirls to look across the darkened room. The first baby has dropped off the easy chair and is energetically crawling away toward a shadowy corner.

direction.raw_text: Nathan and Florence are sitting stock-still, staring at the ceiling. After a moment, another baby starts crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're they, playing telephone? They stare at the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loose babies are crawling everywhere. Hi is skittering across the room in a half-crouch, a baby tucked under one arm, reaching out with the other as he pursues a crawling baby across the room. He hefts the other baby with his free arm and brings the air back to the crib. He turns to look frantically around the room. The other three babies have disappeared. There is perfect quiet. Hi goes over to the closet door, which is ajar, and swings it open. He reaches under a moving pile of clothes on the floor and pulls out a baby. He returns it to the crib and freezes, listening. The sound of a rattle. He drops to the floor to look under the crib.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A baby holding a rattle leers into the camera in the foreground. Behind him Hi, on his stomach, is reaching in to grab at his leg. Hi is pulling the baby out, away from the camera, when with a plop! a baby drops onto Hi 's back from the crib above. Hi twists one arm back to grope for the baby crawling on top of him. He is straightening up, a baby in each arm, when he reacts in horror to something he sees across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hindquarters of a diapered baby are just disappearing around the corner of the nursery door into the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Florence and Nathan are staring at the ceiling. After a beat we hear a muffled plop! on the ceiling. A beat later, the bleat of the squeeze-me toy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Whyn't you go up and check on 'em? They sound restless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The floor-level wide-angle shot shows a baby crawling toward the camera in the foreground. Behind him, in the background, just rounding the open door from the nursery, yet another baby is making a mad dash for freedom. Hi emerges from the nursery and, stepping around the background baby, trots toward the baby in the foreground. By the time he reaches it the low-angle cropping shows us only his feet and calves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perspiring as he tiptoes the last two steps to the baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The baby and, beyond it, the stairway down to the main floor. We hear footsteps approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He scoops up the baby and hurriedly tiptoes away toward the nursery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The baby at the nursery door in the foreground; the staircase in the background. As Hi reaches the baby we hear footsteps climbing the stairs. Hi's free arm comes down into frame to scoop the baby up and out of frame just as: Florence's head appears, bobbing up as she climbs the stairs. She approaches the nursery, still clutching the Dr. Spock book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Florence enters from the hallway door. We track back into the room, on her, as she approaches the crib. Halfway there she freezes, staring, in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of the babies have been replaced in the crib but not lying down: They are seated in a row, staring back at her, lined up against the far crib railing, like a small but distinguished panel on "Meet the Press."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Hi approaching the car. He is shrugging and displaying a pair of manifestly empty hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barely able to fight down her anger. Hissing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?! Hi appears at her - the driver's-window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry honey, it just didn't work out. He is reaching to open the door but she slaps his hand away from the handle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What d'you mean it didn't work out?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They started cryin', then they were all over me... He is trying to open the door, which Ed is holding shut with all her might.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...It was kinda horrifying - Lemme in, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Course they cried! Babies cry!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that now! Come on honey, we better leave - Ed is rolling up the window and locking the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You go right back up there and get me a toddler! I need a baby, Hi; they got more'n they can handle! Muffled, through the closed window, and very forlorn:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw honey I -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you come back here without a baby!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Florence is holding one of the babies cradled against her shoulder. She is facing the hallway door; her back is to the crib and window. The baby, peeping out over her shoulder, is facing the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of the window, as Hi's head appears in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking back, he holds a finger to his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Florence starts bouncing it, patting it on the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi and the window bouncing up and down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan is leafing through the lingerie ads in the newspaper. We can hear Florence's returning footsteps. Muttering:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christian Dior my butt... Florence enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...They pay money for that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How're the kids?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuckin' kids, I love 'em. We hear the bleat of the squeeze-me toy. Florence and Nathan look at the ceiling for a beat, then Nathan clears his throat and returns to the newspaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed sits anxiously waiting in the driver's seat, peering intently through the windshield. As she catches sight of something she breaks into a broad smile, unlocks the door, and slides over to the passenger seat. Hi is opening the door with one hand, cradling a baby in the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one ya get? As he gets into the driver's seat:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno. Nathan Jr., I think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme here. He hands her the infant, then hands her the copy of Dr.Spock's Baby and Child Care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's the instructions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, he's beautiful! Hi nods as he pulls away from the curb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's awful damn good. I think I got the best one. Ed is gushing and kissing the baby through the rest of the conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet they were all beautiful. All babies are beautiful!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. This one's awful damn good though.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you cuss around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's fine, he is. I think it's Nathan Jr.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are doin' the right thing, aren't we Hi? - I mean, they had more'n they could handle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well now honey we been over this and over this. There's what's right and there's what's right, and never the twain shall meet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you don't think his momma'll be upset? I mean overly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well a course she'll be upset, sugar, but she'll get over it. She's got four little babies almost as good as this one. It's like when I was robbin' convenience stores - Ed suddenly bursts out crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love him so much!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you do, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love him so much!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the lights are thrown on. The room is hung with streamers. A string of cut-out letters reads "Welcome Home Son!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, bring him in!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed is entering with Nathan Jr.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is it young Nathan Jr. Just feast your eyes about, old boy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be so loud around him, Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn, I'm sorry honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And don't you cuss around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, he don't know a cuss word from shinola.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well see that he don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's all right, he is. He reaches for the child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Come on over here, Nathan Jr., I'll show you around. He takes the baby in both hands and holds him out at arm's length, pointing him at the various places of interest. The baby looks goggle-eyed at each one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Lookahere, young sportsman. That - there's the kitchen area where Ma and Pa chow down. Over there's the TV, two hours a day maximum, either educational or football so's you don't ruin your appreciation of the finer things. This - here's the divan, for sociahzin' and relaxin' with the family unit. Yessir, many's the day we sat there and said wouldn't it be nice to have a youngster here to share our thoughts and feelin's - Impatient with the nonsense:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's tired, Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well we'll just sit you right there, boy... He is propping Nathan Jr. up in the corner of the couch. Hi sits at the other corner and Ed sits in a facing chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Just put those dogs up'n take a load off. Hi beams at Nathan Jr. Ed smiles at Nathan Jr. Nathan Jr. looks from one to the other, deadpan. They seem to be waiting for him to contribute to the conversation. Silence. Suddenly Hi slaps his knee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you kiddin'?! We got a family here! Ed is getting up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...He's a scandal, honey! He's a little outlaw! As she picks up the baby:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a good boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ain't too good! You can tell by that twinkle in his eye!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you think we should put him to bed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang on, honey... He is frantically reaching for a Polaroid camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Let's us preserve the moment in pictures!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just one, okay?... She sits down on the couch with Nathan Jr. as Hi starts screwing the camera into a tripod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I gotta tell ya, I'm a little scared. Absently, as he sets up the camera:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come is that, honey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well we got a baby, Hi. It's an awful big responsibility. As he peers through the lens:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, could ya slide over a tad and raise the nipper up? As she complies:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean we never done this before and I'm kinda nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're doin' real good, sugar. Hi sits on the couch, holding the camera's cable release. He puts his arm around Ed and smiles at the offscreen camera. Ed nestles her head against Hi's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're set to pop here, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gonna help, aren't ya? Through his teeth as he continues to grin at the offscreen camera:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's that, honey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give Nathan Jr. a normal family background, just quiet evenings at home together... We begin to hear distant thunder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can count on it, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Everything decent'n normal from here on out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh. As he squeezes the cable release - FLASH - the image momentarily freezes on Hi beaming, Nathan Jr. staring, and Ed looking at Hi with a little bit of concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rolling thunder has built to a thunderclap at the cut, and the flash of the Polaroid match cuts to lightning throwing a momentarily harsh glare on the field. Rain beats down on the bare patch of ground we are looking at - by now just a patch of mud. Faraway lightning flickers and we hear the rumble of more thunder approaching, then suddenly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - A head pops up out of the mud. It is Gale, the con we saw in group therapy. He bellows as lightning and thunder flash and crack nearby. His head is covered with mud, although the driving rain is already starting to wash it away. We are beginning to track in an arc around Gale's head, who is now struggling, working to get his shoulders and arms up out of the mud. The end of the 180-degree arc and a flash of lightning reveal, way in the distance, the wire-topped walls of a penitentiary. Still bellowing, as if in some primal rage, Gale has gotten his muck-covered arms up out of the earth and is now pushing down to haul up the rest of his body. It comes with much effort, and with the loud sucking-popping sounds of the fiercely clinging mud. Finally he is free. With a great cry, the mud-covered man plunges his right arm straight back down into the earth, all the way up to his shoulder. He gropes intently and then, apparently having grabbed hold of something underground, he starts pulling. His arm comes slowly back up out of the mud. Clasped in his hand is - a human foot. Bellowing with effort he continues to pull, liberating the foot... leg... torso of his companion, and finally his head. As the rain starts to wash the mud off his companion's head we see that it is his friend Evelle. Both are bellowing. Mud sucks and pops. Thunder crashes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the cut the ear-splitting thunder drops out to quiet. We hear only the muffled patter of rain and the hum of a bare fluorescent. The two bedraggled escaped cons are standing side by side, combing their hair in the mirror. The men seem absorbed in their task, using hair jelly from a jar that sits on the shelf between them to restore their duck's-ass haircuts. Evelle cracks the bathroom door and looks out into the rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mercury. Looks nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two men are trotting out to a Mercury that sits untended at a gas island, a gas hose on automatic stuck in its tank. As Gale starts up the car Evelle yanks the hose out and drops it to the ground. Gale is already starting to peel out as Evelle gets in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TRAILER LIVING ROOM Late at night. Hi sits asleep on the sofa at the far end of the room, in a pool of lamp light. We hear faint, distant knocking. As we track in toward Hi the knocking becomes louder and more present. As we approach Hi we see that several Polaroids are spread over his gently rising and falling chest. By the time we tighten on his face the knocking has become quite loud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open up! Hi starts awake with a grunt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Open up in air! He looks up, alarmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The front door of the trailer. Someone is pounding insistently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open up! It's a police!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sits up and tenses. He looks around. Ed stands in her nightgown at the mouth of the hallway, holding Nathan Jr. and squinting at Hi. She hisses:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi! What's goin' on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Po-lice, son! Open her up! Hi gets to his feet, hurriedly tosses the Polaroids under a cushion of the couch and takes out a gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They ain't gonna take Nathan?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I'd like to see 'em fly. As Ed turns back to the bedroom:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open up and maybe we'll letcha plea- bargain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Ed enters and shuts the door. She listens hard at the door: Hi's footsteps cross the living room, the click of the door opening, silence... a burst of raucous male laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Honey! Come on out here! Want you to meet a couple friends of mine!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Ed enters, carrying Nathan Jr. All three men - Hi, Gale, and Evelle - are beaming at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, like you to meet Gale and Evelle Snopes, fine a pair as ever broke and entered. Gale roars with laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Boys, this - here's my wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miz McDunnough. Ed smiles politely, then squints at Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kind of late for visitors, isn't it Hi?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well yeah honey, but these boys tell me they just got outta the joint. Gotta show a little hospitality. Gale is admiring the baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well now H.I., looks like you been up to the devil's bidnis!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That a him or a her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a little boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a name, does he? Hi and Ed look at each other uncomfortably. Hi clears his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well so far we just been using Junior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We call him Junior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, thairs good - JR., just like on the Teevee. Gale is staring at the streamers and decorations. Reading aloud:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Welcome... Home... Son." Where's he been? Hi and Ed respond simultaneously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tulsa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phoenix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was, uh... he was visiting his grandparents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're separated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was that yer folks ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm afraid not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought yer folks was dead, H.I.?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well we thought Junior should see their final resting place - Whyn't you boys have a seat? As the two men move toward the couch Ed hesitantly pipes up:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, it's two in the morning... She wrinkles her nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...What's that smell? Apologetically:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't always smell like this, Miz McDunnough. I was just explainin' to yer better half here that when we were tunneln' out we hit the main sewer - dumb luck, that - and just followed that to -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean you busted out of jail!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Waaaal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We released ourselves on our own recognizance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What Evelle means to say is, we felt the institution no longer had anything to offer us. He is looking at the baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...My Lord he's cute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a little outlaw, you can see that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now listen, you folks can't stay here! Gale, Evelle, and Hi look up at Ed, dumbstruck. After a beat:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just can't stay! I appreciate your bein' friends of Hi and all, but this is a decent family now... She looks at Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I mean we got a toddler here! Gale leans in close to Hi, a look of sincere concern on his face, and says under his breath:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, who wears the pants round here H.I.?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now honey -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you honey me. Now you boys can set a while and catch up, and then you'll be on your way. There is an awkward silence as she leaves and slams the bedroom door. Gale is carefully studying his thumbnail; Evelle stares fixedly at the ceiling. Still looking at his thumb:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotcha on a awful short leash, don't she H.I.?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometime later, as Hi tiptoes in. Ed lies in bed facing the wall; we see only the back of her head. Hi sits gingerly on the edge of the bed and, smiling, sticks a finger through the bars of the crib to play with the baby. The sound of the TV set in the living room filters faintly in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They still here? Hi is momentarily startled, then goes on playing with the baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, they're just gonna stay a day or two. It's raining out honey, they got nowhere to go. Ed finally turns to face him. We hear the two men laugh raucously in the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're fugitives, Hi... Hi turns to face her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...How're we gonna start a new life with them around?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well now honey you gotta have a little charity. Ya know, in Arab lands they'd set out a plate -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise just a day or two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tonight and tomorrow, tops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking straight down at Hi, asleep in bed. It is later: filtering softly in from the other room is the end of the "Star Spangled Banner" on TV. We are craning down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That night I had a dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a brief moment we see a wall of flames and hear it roar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still craning down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I'd drifted off thinkin' about happiness, birth, and new life...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wall of flames. Deafening roar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Craning down. The faint National Anthem ends: we hear the WEEEEEEEE of a test pattern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But now I was haunted by a vision of -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roaring. At the cut: WHOOOOOSH! a huge low-rider motorcycle bursts through the flames, its engine roaring even louder than the fire. Its driver is a huge leather-clad hellion. The chains worn by the Biker clank ominously as he rides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was horrible... The Biker roars out of frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the Biker roars into frame, his rear tire laying down a wake of fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...a lone biker of the apocalypse...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he roars along a ribbon of desert highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...a man with all the powers of her at his command. The Biker reaches for his bullwhip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...He could turn the day into night... The Biker cracks the whip and, at the crack: The sky behind him turns instantly to black. Bolts of lightning crackle across it as thunder roars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracking with and also in on the Biker from behind as he roars along a strip of highway. He is reaching for the two sawed-off shotguns which are strapped crisscross across his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and laid to waste everything in his path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pulling the Biker from a distance as he levels the two shotguns. The tracking camera pulls back further to reveal a running jack-rabbit keeping pace with us in the foreground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was especially hard on the little things...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - as the first shotgun spurts orange the foreground rabbit keels over. The Biker slues the other gun around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On a rock in the foreground, a desert lizard suns himself. The Biker is approaching in the distant background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...the helpless and the gentle creatures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - from afar, the foreground lizard is blown away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of the empty desert road stretching away. In the foreground a lone desert flower blooms. The Biker roars into frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He left a scorched earth in his wake, befouling even the sweet desert breeze that whipped across his brow. As the Biker roars away, the foreground flower bends with his draft and then bursts into flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From in front. He twirls the shotguns in either hand and reaches back to plunge them over his shoulders into their holsters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know where he came from or why... We are moving in on his chest, where two crisscrossed bandoliers carry two rows of hand grenades, their silver pins glinting in the sun. We follow the line of one of the bandoliers up to his right shoulder which bears the tattoo: "Mama Didn't Love Me."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know if he was dream or vision...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From behind, booming down as we track. We are approaching the crest of a rise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I feared that I myself had unleashed him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of the Biker approaching, craning down as he draws near.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...for he was The Fury That Would Be... With the crane down we momentarily lose him from view over the rise; then suddenly - ROAR - he tops the rise and, wheels spinning, is airborne
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he crashes back down to earth in the foreground and roars away. Only now we are no longer in the desert: We are looking down a twilight street at the end of which is the Arizona house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...as soon as Florence Arizona found her little Nathan gone. The roar of his engine and clank of his chains recede as the Biker gradually dissolves into thin air. We are left looking at the empty street and the faraway Arizona house. The receding roar has left behind eerily beautiful singing, a woman singing a lullaby. Faintly, behind the singing, there is also a droning high-pitched noise. The camera starts floating forward very close to the ground, moving slowly toward the Arizona house. The high-pitched drone is becoming less faint under the singing. The camera is accelerating. The drone is growing louder - we can now tell that it is a human scream. As we approach the Arizona house we can see that a ladder is propped up to a second-story window. We are moving quite fast now. The scream all but buries the singing. We are rushing toward the house, toward the base of the ladder, the sustained scream drawing us on. We hurtle toward and then straight up the ladder with no abatement of speed, sucked forward by the deafening scream. We reach the top and hurtle - THWAP! - through the white curtains of the open second-story window into the nursery to reveal Florence Arizona, her back to us, screaming over the crib. We are rocketing toward her. She is turning to us, hands pressed to her ears, mouth stretched wide in an ear-splitting shriek and we are rushing into an extreme close-up of her gaping mouth and her wildly vibrating epiglottis and we
direction.name: direction

One cop in front of him is pointing a direction. The Biker is shaking his head; he doesn't think they went that way. Suddenly, with a loud whipcrack effect, the Biker's head snaps to profile. He is staring across the field, stock-still, having heard, smelled or sensed something. The dogs milling around the hole also react, snapping to attention, a split second after the BIKER.

Hi looks around the parking lot, bewildered. The wailing siren is becoming painfully loud. Hi looks behind him at the plate-glass front of the store, where a bullet pock mars the glass.

direction.raw_text: Through the glass we see the pimply young Cashier with the paper 7-Eleven cap pop up from behind the counter to sight down his huge .44 Magnum for another shot. The gun is so big he uses both hands to heft it.

direction.raw_text: - the bullet kisses another hole in the glass. Hi is off and running. The squad car is screeching into the lot. An officer tumbles out of the passenger side before the car is fully stopped. He rolls on the pavement, then hurriedly rights himself and takes up a half-kneeling shooting stance. At the same time the little Cashier is emerging from the 7- Eleven with his gun. The two bang away at Hi's retreating figure - the Policeman's revolver popping, the Cashier's Magnum booming. We hear the Policeman who is still in the car drawling over its loudspeaker:

direction.raw_text: Halt. It's a police warning, son. Put those groceries down and turn yourself in.

direction.raw_text: Legs pumping, panty hose still over his head, its unused leg streaming behind him like an aviator's scarf. Behind him we can see the OFFICER and the Cashier squeeze off another couple shots, and then the policeman piles back into the squad car.

direction.raw_text: Driving. She hears distant gunshots.

direction.raw_text: That son of a bitch... Hold on, Nathan. We're gonna go pick up Daddy. She hangs a vicious U-turn.

direction.raw_text: Huffing and puffing down the road with his Huggies. The cop car careens onto the street in the background, its siren wailing. The PASSENGER COP is leaning far out his window, one hand gripping the light-and-siren rack, the other pointing a gun at Hi, shooting away. Bullets whizz past. Suddenly, with a soft pthunk! the Huggies box pops forward, out from under Hi's arm - hit by a bullet. Still running, Hi reaches forward, tries to catch it on the fly, bobbles it, tips it - loses it. He overruns it a couple steps before he can bring himself up short. He turns and reaches to pick up the box but - PING-PING - bullets chew up the road near his hand. Leaving the Huggies, Hi takes off through a well-manicured yard. The police car is proceeding on down the street to catch him around the corner, the driver still drawling over his loudspeaker:

A second dog peels into the road to bound along with the Doberman.

As the police car roars down the street, Ed's car appears from between two houses behind it, bounces down the front yard to the street and follows the police.

direction.raw_text: We are tracking behind Hi as he runs up to the house and crashes through the screen door. Still tracking behind him as he runs through the living room. A middle-aged couple sits on the couch watching TV. They look up as Hi rushes by. Hi plunges down a staircase. As he does so we hear: ka-chick ka-chock ka-chick ka-chock. direction.raw_text: As Hi bursts in. Tracking on him as he runs down the broad front aisle, head whipping as he runs, looking up each perpendicular lane, searching for something. He turns up one of the last lanes, races along it and grabs a carton of Huggies, still on the flat run. He emerges into the broad back aisle and runs along it, but at the first perpendicular lane he hits, we see Officer Steensma, gun leveled, at the other end. He fires. Hi keeps running. The Policeman is running along the front aisle, keeping pace with Hi running along the back aisle. He squeezes off shots at Hi as each lane gives him the opportunity. Hi abruptly stops between lanes and doubles back, losing the Policeman. He runs down the second lane he comes to toward the front of the store. The pack of dogs appears at the end of the lane and thunders up toward Hi, braying at the top of their doggy lungs. The lead Doberman holds in his teeth a paper 7-Eleven cap. Hi reverses again, and emerges into the back aisle.

direction.raw_text: ! A pyramid of cranberry juice explodes at his shoulder. The Policeman has been waiting at the end of the back aisle; he aims once again. Hi plunges down the next lane but is brought up short as KA- BOOM! five jars of applesauce explode in front of him. Hi looks. Standing in the raised platform-cubicle at the front of the store is the Store Manager, a fat man in a white short-sleeved shirt with a lit cigarette dangling from his mouth. The Manager cracks open his shotgun and inserts two more cartridges - THOONK THOONK - in the smoking chamber. Hi doubles back once again toward the back aisle. He is still several paces from the end of the lane when the Policeman appears there, squaring to face him. The Policeman is in front of him. The MANAGER is blowing out groceries on the shelves behind him.

direction.raw_text: Racing on down the back aisle, bellowing.

direction.raw_text: ...but you're wanted by the authorities and you're a bad influence in this household, in my opinion.

direction.raw_text: I'm goin' in to town tomorrow to see about some shots for the baby. When I come back you better be gone or I'll kick you out myself. She storms into the bedroom and slams the door. There is an awkward silence as Gale studies his thumb and Evelle stares at the ceiling. Finally Evelle turns to Hi.

direction.raw_text: ...What's he need, his dip-tet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm awful sorry boys, but when Ed gets mad, you know, when she gets an idea...

direction.raw_text: ...It seems pretty clear what the situation is here.

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I guess the Missus wants us to clear out.

direction.raw_text: Now H.I., you'll pardon me for sayin' so, but I get the feelin' that this- here... His gesture seems to take in the trailer and the entire domestic situation.

direction.raw_text: ...ain't exactly workin' out.

direction.raw_text: Well now Ed's generally a real sweetheart, I- GALE And as per usual, I wouldn't be surprised if the source of the marital friction was financial.

direction.raw_text: Well, matter of fact, I did lose my job today-

direction.raw_text: Come on Hi. you're young, you got your health - what do you want with a job?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But look, I'd rather light a candle than curse your darkness. As you know, Evelle'n I never go anywhere without a reason... and here we are in your little domicile. We come to invite you in on a score.

direction.raw_text: A bank, Hi. Hi is shaking his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw boys, I don't-

direction.raw_text: I know you're partial to convenience stores but, H.I., the sun don't rise and set on the corner grocery.

direction.raw_text: It's like Doc Schwartz says: You gotta have a little ambition. Why we just heard on the news how somebody snatched off one of the Arizona babies. Now there's someone thinkin' big.

direction.raw_text: And here you are sittin' around on your butt playin' house with a - don't get me wrong, H.I., with a fine woman - but a woman who needs the button-down type.

direction.raw_text: Well now that ain't really any of your-

direction.raw_text: Though the locals call it the Farmers and Mechanics Bank of LaGrange. Looks like a hayseed bank and, tell you the truth, it is a hayseed bank. Except the last Friday of every financial quarter there's more cash in that bank than flies at a barbecue.

direction.raw_text: And guess what day it is tomorrow?

direction.raw_text: Ya see, H.I., it's when the hayseeds come in to cash their farm subsidy checks.

direction.raw_text: A-One information.

direction.raw_text: He's in for solicitin' sex from a state trooper.

direction.raw_text: Ordinarily we don't associate with that class of person, but... Gale chuckles.

direction.raw_text: ...he was tryin' to make brownie points with some of the boys.

direction.raw_text: Boys, I can't -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need someone handy with a scatter- gun to cover the hayseeds while we get the cash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'understand, H.I., if this works out it's just the beginning of a spree across the entire Southwest proper. We keep goin' 'till we can retire - or we get caught.

direction.raw_text: Either way we're fixed for life. Hi is still shaking his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boys, it's a kind offer, but you're suggesting I just up'n leave Ed. Now that'd be pretty damn cowardly, wouldn't it.

direction.raw_text: Would it?  Think about it, H.I. Seems to me, stayin' here, y'ain't doin' her any good. And y'ain't bein' true to your own nature. The camera has floated in to a close shot of Hi, staring glumly at GALE.

direction.raw_text: Following it, very close, we see only its rear wheel and fender and twin exhaust pipes, one on either side. Flame is boiling in each exhaust pipe as the hog roars.

direction.raw_text: From behind the Biker's head as he rides through the night. With the sharp whipcrack effect he suddenly looks left, searching. With a second whipcrack effect he suddenly looks right, still searching. He banks into a turn.

direction.raw_text: Creeping in. Late at night. We are tracking in toward the one window that is illuminated, with a feeble yellow light. In voice-over, Hi is composing a letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dearest Edwinna. Tonight as you and Nathan slumber, my heart is filled with anguish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TRAILER Creeping in on Hi 's hunched back, as he sits over the kitchen table writing the letter. The yellow lamp sitting on the table is the only light on in the trailer.

direction.raw_text: ...I hope that you will both understand, and forgive me for what I have decided I must do. By the time you read this, I will be gone.

direction.raw_text: Creeping in on GALE and EVELLE, sprawled on the sofa and easy chair respectively, sawing boards.

direction.raw_text: ...I will never be the man that you want me to be, the husband and father that you and Nathan deserve...

direction.raw_text: Still creeping in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it's my upbringing; maybe it's just that my genes got screwed up - I don't know...

direction.raw_text: . 7-ELEVEN Creeping in on the pimply-faced Cashier, sitting asleep behind the counter, a dirty magazine lying face-down, open on his chest.

direction.raw_text: But the events of the last day have showed, amply, that I don't have the strength of character to raise up a family... We are slowly panning over to the newspaper rack, revealing tomorrow's headline: "WHERE IS NATHAN JR.?"

direction.raw_text: ...in the manner befitting a responsible adult, and not like the wild man from Borneo.

direction.raw_text: Creeping in on Nathan Jr. in the living room, asleep in his ottoman armchair, lit only by the snow from the TV set he is facing, a half-full glass of milk on the coffee table next to him. His robe is disheveled; his eyeglasses have slid down his nose.

direction.raw_text: ...I say all this to my shame.

direction.raw_text: Creeping in on Ed and Nathan Jr., asleep together in the double bed. Ed's arm is draped protectively over the sleeping infant.

direction.raw_text: ...I will love you always, truly and deeply. But I fear that if I stay I would only bring bad trouble... We start to hear the rumble of the motorcycle mix up again.

direction.raw_text: I feel the thunder gathering even now; if I leave, hopefully, it will leave with me. We are craning up over the Biker's back to reveal what he is looking at: We are on a bluff overlooking the trailer park. In the window of one trailer below, a yellow light glows.

direction.raw_text: I cannot tarry...

direction.raw_text: Still creeping in.

direction.raw_text: Better I should go, send you money, and let you curse my name. Your loving... Herbert.

direction.raw_text: Roaring at the cut. Through it we can see the Biker sitting on the ground, legs stretched out in front of him, back resting against his parked motorcycle, arms folded across his chest. Perfectly motionless, he stares at the campfire. We are floating in toward him. As we come closer, eventually drawing in to a close shot of his face, we gradually realize something peculiar about his eyes: He seems to have none. Although his eyes are unblinkingly open we do not see eyeballs, but only fire - either a reflection of the campfire or something roaring - burning-inside.

direction.raw_text: Biting down on the cigar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dragging the kitchen match along the unfinished wood surface of an expensive bureau, leaving an ugly black scar. The match erupts into roaring flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crackling as it is lit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reading "Executive Offices." The mailed fist pushes it open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the inside of the office. The name on the pebbled glass is a backwards Nathan Arizona. There is the shadow of a man approaching the door, and muffled voices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Mr. Arizona, he just barged in... The door swings open and Nathan stands looking in, his middle- aged secretary hanging at his elbow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Should I call Dewayne? Nathan is staring toward his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell no, why wake the security guard. I'll take care a this. The secretary leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Biker sits with his back to us, jackboots propped lazily on the desk. His head bobs and ducks, as if he is following some movement in the air in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eyes on the Biker he slams the door shut behind him, looking for some reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No reaction. His head continues to bob and duck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Circling the Biker as he crosses to sit behind his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arcing around to reveal the Biker's face. He still does not react to Nathan, not even bothering to give him a glance. His eyes continue to follow some phantom movement. When the Biker speaks it is still without looking at Nathan, and with a surprisingly soft voice and mild, unhurried manner:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got flies. He finally looks at Nathan, and smiles faintly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I doubt it. This place's climate- controlled, all the windows are sealed. Who the hell are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Name of Leonard Smalls. My friends call me Lenny... He takes a drag on his cigar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Only I ain't got no friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop, you'll make me bust out crying. Listen Leonard, you want some furniture or a shitbox, they're out on the sales floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is pleasantly shaking his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nooo, I ain't a customer, I'm a manhunter. Ordinarily. Though I do hunt babies, on occasion. Hear you got one you can't put your hand to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wal, that's my business. I'm a tracker- part Hopi Indian, some say part hound dog. When some dink skips bail, crashes outta the joint, I'm the man they call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister, I got the cops, the state troopers and the Federal-B-I already lookin' for my boy. Now if you got information I strongly advise-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cop won't find your boy. Cop couldn't find his own butt if it had a bell on it. Wanna find an outlaw, call an outlaw. Wanna find a Dunkin Donuts, call a cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smalls, first off, take your damn feet off m'furniture. Second off, it's widely known I posted a twenty grand reward for my boy. If you can find him, claim it. Short of that what do we got to talk about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Price. Fair price. And that ain't whatever you say it is; fair price is what the market'll bear. Now there are people, mind you, there are people in this land, who'll pay a lot more'n twenty grand for a healthy baby. Nathan is looking at him stonily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you after?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give you an idea, when I was a lad I m'self fetched twenty-five thousand on the black market. And them's 1954 dollars. I'm sayin, fair price. For fifty grand I'll track him, find him- Quick as a flash the heretofore languid Smalls bolts forward, his fist stopped an inch short of Nathan's nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SMALLS' FINGERS His index finger and thumb are pinched together-holding the leg of a struggling fly that he has just plucked from the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and the people that took him... He flicks the fly away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I'll kick their butts. He sits back down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...No extra charge. Nathan stares grimly at Smalls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I don't pay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh I'll get your boy regardless. Cause if you don't pay, the market will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna know what I think? I think you're an evil man. I think this is nothin' but a goddamn screw job. I think it's a shakedown. I think you're the one took Nathan Jr. and my fine friend, I think you're the one gonna get his butt kicked... Nathan swivels to punch numbers on a telephone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I'm on the phone to the cops right now, and I- He swivels back, looking up, and his speech stops short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The office is empty. A whipcrack effect builds to the cut and:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes snap open as the whipcrack echoes away. He has been slumped over the kitchen table, asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up and attem, H.I. Today is the first day of the rest of your life...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and already you're fuckin' it up. Hi looks up. Gale and Evelle are smiling down at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, the missus'll be back from town soon. Hi takes the envelope that he was slumped over, to Ed written on its face. As he sticks it to the refrigerator door with a broccoli magnet:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the baby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bedroom, in his crib.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's sawin' toothpicks, he'll be fine. There is a harsh knock at the door. All three tense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...You expectin' anybody? Hi is staring. The knock comes again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You two stay outta sight. He goes to the door, pulls back its shade and peeks out. Under his breath:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. He opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is Glen. He backs nervously down to the foot of the stoop as Hi stands in the half open doorway. Glen comes to rest a few feet away from the stoop. He is wearing a neckbrace. The bridge of his eyeglasses is taped together. Cotton wadding is stuffed up his nose, which is darkly discolored. He holds a rolled up newspaper. His station wagon is parked behind him, idling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning Glen. Glen speaks in a very nasal voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't comin' in if ya don't mind. I'll just keep my distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't invite you in, Glen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well don't even bother. First off, you're fired - and that's official.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I kinda figured that, Glen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well that ain't why I'm here neither. No sir. You're in a whole shitload of trouble, my friend. Hi is looking at him evenly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you just calm down, Glen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you make me?! Know that little baby you got in there? Remember him? I know what his real name is! Hi is suddenly nervous and urgent:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna keep your voice down, Glen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll pitch my voice wherever I please! His name ain't Hi Jr.! His name ain't Ed Jr.! But it's junior an right! Yes sir, it's Nathan Jr.! Hi takes one step down holding out a calming hand. Glen takes two nervous steps away and reassures himself by resting a hand on the door of his station wagon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Stay away from me, McDunnough! Hi stops short. Glen smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Sure, you're an awful big man when you got somethin' around to clobber a guy with!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't a big man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right! And now you're at my mercy! He spits on the dirt in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I'm your worst nightmare!  I wanted to just turn you in for the re-ward. But Dot, she wants something to cuddle. So it looks like that baby's gonna be Glen Jr. From now on! Hi's face is set in rigid dismay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I'll give you a day to break the news to Ed... Glen is getting into his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Dot'll be by tomorrow to pick him up. He slams the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...It's either that or jail. Oh and say, that reminds me! You'll find a doctor bill in the mail in a few days. I recommend you pay it! And the car squeals off. Hi looks back at the trailer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A slat in the window blind drops back into place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelle is already emerging from the bedroom with the baby in his arms. Hi moves toward Evelle. His teeth are set; he means business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's goin' on here. Gale steps in front of Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what's goin' on, H.I. It's just business. Now this can go either hard or easy- Hi gives Gale a hard push to get past him. Gale staggers back but recovers and grabs Hi in a bear hug. Hi flips Gale. Gale lands on a coffee table which flips up and crashes back down. Evelle is dancing back out of Hi's reach. As Hi lunges for him the prostrate Gale grabs his legs. Hi goes down hard. Gale leaps to his feet and - CRASH - bangs his head up against an overhanging lamp. Both of his hands fly up to massage the top of his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Hi's fist flies into frame to connect with Gale's unguarded stomach. Gale doubles over, clutching at his gut. Hi interlaces his fingers to make a club of his two hands. With Gale's bowed head a target in front of him, Hi swings his hands up over his head. Hi's knuckles scrape painfully against the plaster of the too - low ceiling. Skin is flayed, plaster crumbles. Hi grabs at his knuckles in pain. Gale lunges with a mid- body tackle that sends Hi crashing into the wall. Gale, still on top of him, reaches back to throw a punch. The reach-back sends his elbow crashing through a window but doesn't stop the punch. It connects with Hi's jaw. Gale throws another quick punch, all his weight behind it. Hi's head bobs sideways just in time and Gale's fist goes through the wall. It is momentarily stuck there. Hi uses the opportunity to grab Gale's one free arm with both of his. He is twisting it to make Gale, roaring with pain, twist around and present his back to him. Hi climbs aboard, grabbing Gale's face. Gale, still roaring, is pulling his fist out of the hole. He grabs a lath exposed by the hole and pulls; it tears out of the wall and snaps free, giving him a length of about two feet. Gale is rampaging around like a grizzly bear hemmed in a too- small space. Hi is hanging on for dear life, his own feet flailing this way and that, knocking over lamps and wall fixtures as Gale bends and twirls about, trying to shake him loose. Gale crashes and bounces off the walls, roaring in pain and fury. Close shots of Gale's face show his features impossibly and grotesquely contorted by Hi's hand, squeezing, gripping and clutching at it. Evelle is dancing around with the baby, dodging crashing furniture and flailing body parts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WIDE SHOT THE TRAILER At the cut Gale's roaring drops out. We hear the chirping of birds and the laughter of children playing in the neighborhood. It is a sunny day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TRAILER Gale still roars. With a last mighty effort, he finally swings Hi off his body. Hi crashes against a wall and through it to land in the:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amid a shower of plaster dust and lath. Hi has landed, groggily, against the toilet. Evelle enters now with his hands free, apparently having set the baby down somewhere. He yanks the cord off the bathroom blinds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi is seated in a straight-back chair, still violently struggling but Gale's arms are wrapped around him from behind. Evelle is just finishing tying off his wrists behind the chair. No one talks; there is nothing left to say. Finished, Gale goes to the door and Evelle goes to the bedroom. He emerges with the baby and precedes Gale out the door, Gale slamming it behind him. Hi starts bucking and struggling, weeping tears of rage and frustration. He succeeds only in tipping forward, face down into the carpet, the strapped-on chair pressing down on top of him. His profile is pressed into the carpet. Offscreen we hear the door of the trailer opening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At carpet level. Gale's shoes enter his field of vision. They stride over to a mess of debris in the corner of the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Gale paws through the wreckage to expose the copy of Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care. He grabs the book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The feet walk away and leave his field of vision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As we hear the door slam shut with horrible finality. Hi's mouth stretches wide. He ROARS with grief and frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving down the road toward an oncoming car. As the oncoming car gets closer we can see Gale and Evelle in its front seat. As the car passes we pan with it, to reveal that we have been shooting from the inside of another car, and we hold on the profile of its driver: Ed. She has just watched the other car shoot past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DEVASTATED TRAILER As Ed sits heavily into frame, apparently in shock, her frozen profile to the camera as she stares straight ahead into space. Her foreground hand absently holds a length of cord. Beyond her in the middle background Hi is rummaging in the debris. He stands up, cropped from the chest down and starts loading bullets into the chamber of Ed's .38 police special.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you're worried honey but believe me, there ain't a thing to worry about. We're gonna get him back, there just ain't no question about that... He snaps the chamber shut and leaves frame, still talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...We'll get him back, that's just all there is to it. And you wanna know another thing? He is walking back into frame holding another handgun now in addition to the .38, this one an automatic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I'm gonna be a better person from here on out. And that's final, I mean that's absolutely the way it's gonna be, that's official. You were right and I was wrong... He snaps a clip into the automatic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...A blind man could tell you that. Now they ain't gonna hurt him, they're just in it for the score... Hi is leaving frame again, continuing to talk as we hear him rummaging offscreen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...But I ain't like that no more, I'm a changed man. You were right and I was wrong. We got a family here and I'm gonna start acting responsibly... Hi enters frame with the two handguns stuck in his belt, holding his pump-action shotgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...So let's go honey... He primes the shotgun: WHOOSH-CLACK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Let's go get Nathan Jr.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the front bumper of an automobile. Beautiful desert stretches to the horizon. The road rushes under the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gale drives, gazing out at the road. Evelle holds Nathan Jr., occasionally bouncing him. Contemplatively:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I luuuuv to drive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said somethin' there, partner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Yessir, I figure with the ransom and this bank, you'n I'll be sittin' in the fabled catbird seat. Evelle is looking down at the baby, shifting him in his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, Gale... Junior had a, uh, accident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that, pardner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He had a little accident. Gale looks over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wuddya mean, he looks okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, ya see... Movin' though we are, he just had hisself a rest stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well it's perfectly natural.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Gale!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What now? Evelle, beaming, looks up from the baby to Gale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...He smiled at me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A huge rumbling rippling red ball that fills the frame. As we hear his footfalls on concrete steps, Smalls rises into frame, apparently climbing a stoop. The sun behind him throws him into silhouette; the extreme telephoto flattens him against the sun. Heat waves ripple between us and him, making his figure slightly waver. The rumble builds, louder and louder, until it is snapped off by a-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The front door handle clicks open and Smalls stands in the doorway. The abandoned trailer is perfectly quiet. The room is a complete shambles from the fight. Sunlight filters in between the slats of the venetian blinds. Smoke from Lenny Smalls' cheroot ripples up through the light. After only a momentary pause at the door to take in the scene, Smalls goes directly to a specific spot in the debris and nudges some of it aside with his toe, exposing a piece of paper. He bends down to pick it up but suddenly freezes, with a soft grunt of surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At knee-height on the wall in front of him, "FART" is scrawled in crayon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he stands up with the piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is Gale's picture of the Farmers and Mechanics Bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close on a carton of diapers being set down on the check-out counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know how you put these thangs on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R Evelle and the Cashier, a late-middle-aged man (perhaps the proprietor of this small mom-and-pop store) face each other across the check-out counter. Evelle has various baby purchases - the diapers, baby food, etc. - piled on the counter. The Cashier is ringing them up. Through the open door beyond them we can see a strip of the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welp. Around the butt, then up over the groin area-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know where they go, old timer. I mean do I need pins or fasteners? We see Gale trotting past through the visible part of the parking lot, cooing "Weeeeee!" as he holds Nathan Jr. Up over his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well no, they got those tape-ettes already on there, it's self-contained and fairly explanatory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh... He takes a plastic-covered squirt gun off a display rack and drops it on the counter. He is looking around at the other impulse purchases displayed by the register; he unhooks a bag of balloons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...These blow up into funny shapes at all? Gale is trotting by in the opposite direction: "Weeeeee!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well no. Unless round is funny. Evelle is pulling a gun out of his belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, I'll take these too. Now you lie down back there-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And don't you move till you've counted up to eight hundred and twenty-five and then backwards down to zero. I'll be back to check - see y'ain't cheatin'. The Cashier is already down on the floor, out of frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You the diaper burglar? As he heads for the door with the groceries:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like I'm one of 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Evelle hurriedly emerges with the two bags. Faintly we can hear the Cashier bellowing: "One one thousand, two one thousand..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the door, will ya? Gale is slipping the baby back into his car seat, which sits on the roof of the car. He starts doing up the straps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a real cheerful little critter once he warms up to ya. Hands free now, Gale reaches for the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry up Gale... Gale has the door open. Evelle starts throwing in the groceries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know how high this one can count.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gale drives as Evelle sorts through his purchases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got him some baby grub... baby wipes... diapers, disposable... packet of balloons-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They blow up into funny shapes at all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, just- Gale is looking around, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, where's Junior?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wuddya mean, didn't you put him in?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I thought- The two men look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two men's heads whip around to look in the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at each other in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd we leave him?! The two men's eyes widen as they remember at the same time: both look up at the roof of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming off the accelerator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Screaming as he watches the foot:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !! But too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Already plunging down on the brake. SQUEEEEEEEAL...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelle is screaming at the top of his lungs as the car rocks to a stop. He peers through the windshield, still screaming, but nothing has shot off the roof of the car. He cranes his neck to look up the slant of the windshield toward the roof. This of course gives him no view; still screaming, he thrusts his body out his open window to look up at the roof. His scream is muted as his head disappears from view, then comes back full force as he ducks back in, frantically shaking his head. With this Gale's last hope disappears and he starts bellowing also.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rising from the brake to plunge down on the accelerator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As it hangs a squealing U-turn and races off at top speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the foreground Nathan Jr. sits upright in his car seat, in the middle of the road that fronts the convenience store. He is placidly looking at the scenery. Faintly, we hear the Cashier bellowing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Seven hunnert ninety-seven one thousand, seven hunnert ninety-six one thousand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In their speeding car, both staring out at the road ahead, mouths gaping, emitting ear-splitting screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shot faces the front of the store with some of the street visible outside. The Cashier on the floor is out of frame, but we can hear him loud and clear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Seven hunnert ninety-one one thousand, seven hunnert - ah... bullshit. He rises into frame, back to the camera, just as: We see Gale and Evelle's car, through the front window, roaring up the street. Quick as a shot, the Cashier has dropped back out of frame and resumes bellowing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven hunnert ninety - ought one thousand! Seven hundred eighty - The car is starting to squeal to a screaming halt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With Nathan Jr. in the foreground. Gale and Evelle's car comes to a rocking halt behind - and inches shy of - the baby. Evelle's door is already open. He bolts from it and runs over to the baby, blubbering. He picks up the car seat and Nathan Jr. Gale is also getting out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise we ain't never gonna give him up, Gale! We ain't never gonna let him go! Gale, choked up, speaks in a low unsteady voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll never give him up, Evelle. He's our little Gale Jr. now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi driving. Both are staring wordlessly ahead at the road. Hi looks over at Ed, glum but trying to be kind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Ed, I realize I can't be much of a comfort to you. But lemme just say this... He is nodding to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll feel a whole lot better when-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't wanna feel better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care about myself anymore. I don't care about us anymore. I just want Nathan Junior back safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we don't get him back safe, I don't wanna go on livin'. And even if we do, I don't wanna go on livin' with you. This shuts Hi up. After a moment:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I guess I still love you Hi; I know I do. I ain't even blaming you. The whole thing was crazy and the whole thing was my idea. Hi clears his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, factually, I myself bear a very large-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lemme finish. Since those jailbirds took little Nathan I been doin' some thinking, and I ain't too proud of myself. Even if Mrs. Arizona had more'n she could handle, I was a police officer sworn to uphold the Constitution of the United States -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now waitaminute honey, you resigned before we-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That ain't the point, Hi. We don't deserve Nathan Jr. Any more'n those jailbirds do. And if I'm as selfish and irresponsible as you-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'ain't that bad, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I'm as bad as you, what good're we to each other. You'n me's just a fool's paradise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baking in the noonday sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sitting in the front seat of their idling car, looking at the bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep. Welp... They look at each other. Gale reaches for his door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Let's do her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Waitaminute. What do we do with Gale Jr.?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wuddya mean, he waits here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy?!  He can't wait here by hisself. Supposin' we get killed in there - it could be hours before he's discovered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Gale and Evelle bang in through the door. Evelle holds a shotgun; Gale holds a shotgun in one hand and Nathan Jr. in his car seat in the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right you hayseeds, it's a stick- up! Everbody freeze! Everbody down on the ground! Everyone freezes, staring at Gale and Evelle. An Old Hayseed with his hands in the air speaks up:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...And it seemed real. It seemed like us. And it seemed like well... our home... If not Arizona, then a land, not too far away, where all parents are strong and wise and capable, and all children are happy and beloved... I dunno, maybe it was Utah. The elderly man drapes an arm around his wife's shoulder and draws her close. She rests her head against his shoulder, and we:
